sentences.sentence: Diplomatic talks but no major breakthrough on Ukraine after Joe Biden spoke to Vladimir Putin by phone on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Movements initiated by Canadian truckers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Anti-Covid restriction demonstrations continue in Canada as more people join the so-called Freedom Convoys.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Super Bowl is fast approaching and the Los Angeles Rams are getting ready to face the Cincinnati Bengals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The conversation between Joe Biden and Vladimir Putin did not diminish the threats of a possible war in Europe,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: but both leaders agreed to continue diplomatic talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: During his call on Saturday, US President warned his Russian counterpart of severe costs if he invaded Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The conversation came at a critical moment as the US insists on saying a Russian invasion could happen by the end of next week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Washington, London and Berlin have already told their citizens to leave the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Moscow is continually denying any attack on Ukraine and calls hysteria such allegations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Saturday, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken also spoke with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, who accused Washington of provoking the conflict by being alarmist. A feeling shared by the government in Kiev, who remained skeptical about an invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And the truth that we have different information and now the best friend for enemies that is panic in our country. And all this information that helps only for panic doesn't help us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, more than 30 ships from the Russian Black Sea Fleet have started training exercises near Crimea, a peninsula annexed by Russia in 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Moscow also claims to have driven a U.S. submarine from its waters in the Pacific Ocean.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Inspired by the self-described freedom convoy in Canada,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: protests against COVID restrictions took place Saturday across Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In The Hague, several hundred of vehicles blocked the city centre and stayed around the seat of the Dutch government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Demonstrators left early in the afternoon after police warned them they would be fined and arrested if they continued.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Paris, police fired tear gas at a handful of people on the Champs-Élysées avenue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At least 500 vehicles attempted to enter the capital at key arteries but were intercepted by police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Several protesters were arrested and knives, hammers and petrol cans were seized in a central square in southern Paris. In the city of Zurich, an unauthorized demonstration led to clashes between militants and security forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Some participants tried to break through police barricades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Swiss police used tear gas, water cannons and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Canada, demonstrations by protesters opposed to vaccine mandates and other COVID restrictions are still going on. On Saturday night, police persuaded many drivers in Windsor to remove their vehicles that had been blocking the Ambassador Bridge, a key border crossing to Detroit in the US.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They left peacefully, but since then more protesters have arrived, and on Sunday morning were still blocking access from the Canadian side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The so-called Freedom Convoys started around a week ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In the nation's capital, Ottawa, protests were also continuing, with thousands of people taking part, as they have on past weekends.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The demonstrators gathered at Parliament Hill, and a line of trucks continued to block the main road in front of the country's capital building.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Anti-vaccine demonstrators have been in camp downtown since late January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In southern Alberta, travel to and from the United States has been suspended by Canadian authorities, as protesters continue to limit access at the Coutts border crossing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It started on January 29th, but lanes have been intermittently open since then.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And in the east, around 500 protesters gathered in downtown Toronto to show their support to the truckers and to protest the COVID-19 restrictions imposed by the Canadian government. There was also support in Montreal on Saturday from Freedom Convoy supporters, but they were met with a small number of counter-protesters objecting to the anti-vaccine demonstrators. The UK Prime Minister is still under pressure

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: to resign over allegations of illegal parties in Downing Street during Covid lockdowns. He's one of around 50 people who've been sent a questionnaire by police in London investigating the accusations over the so-called Partygate affair. So far Johnson has insisted he won't step down and his party's MPs have not launched any official challenge to his leadership. But a recent poll found that 63% of those surveyed think he should resign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Even before the party gates, he wasn't a reliable person and I think we should get rid of him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Partygate comes at a critical time for Johnson, who's one of many European leaders trying to find a diplomatic resolution to the Ukraine crisis.

sentences.sentence: Protests have taken place in Afghanistan against giving over 3 billion euros of Afghan money

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: to the American families of 9-11 victims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The group of demonstrators condemned US President Joe Biden's order to free up the Afghan assets held in the US, saying it belongs to them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They also called for financial compensation for the thousands of Afghans killed during the last 20 years of war in the country.

sentences.sentence: Two tons of equipment are being delivered to Madagascar from the neighbouring island of Reunion by the French armed forces in the southern Indian Ocean Zone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A total of 87 tons of material is meant to be deployed by the French Red Cross to restore the homes of 125,000 people affected by the cyclone Batsirai.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: According to Malagasy authorities, the storm has killed at least 120 people, mainly on the east coast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Both Portugal and Spain are suffering from severe droughts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to climate scientists, it's the worst Portugal has seen in 20 years, with water reservoirs in the country's centre drying out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in Spain in the last four months, there has been only a quarter of the rainfall there should have been.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Low water supplies could create a difficult situation for the coming summer months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California will soon be the scene of American football madness as the Los Angeles Rams take on the Cincinnati Bengals in the Super Bowl, the biggest sporting event of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Rams will be playing at home in an attempt to win the Vince Lombardi Trophy, which they've only won once before, in 2000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Bengals, on the other hand, have never won a Super Bowl before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Both teams prefer to play in the air and on the offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Rams have a slight edge in the standings, but the final should be just like the previous playoff games, very close.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But this year's Super Bowl wants to show once in a lifetime performance both on the field and off.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And it's looking to relaunch the musical performance machine, which has stalled a little due to the health crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For this, organisers have chosen Micky Guyton and Jenny Aiko to perform the national anthem and America the Beautiful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And at half-time, the show will feature some of the top names in hip-hop and R&B with Dr Dre, Eminem, Mary J. Blige and Snoop Dogg.
